summary: hantaviruses related human cases have been observed throughout Asia, Europe, Africa, and North America. to date, 23 distinct species of hantaviruses, hosted by reservoir, have been identified. diversity and number of hantaviruses are likely underestimated in china. in phylogenetic trees, FUGV clustered in lineage corresponding to hantaviruses carried by rodents in the subfamily Arvicolinae. a novel hantavirus species FUGV was identified from the small oriental vole.
